definition: to fish (with line and hook)/to dupe
to fish with a hook and bait
Diaoyu Islands, claimed by China but controlled by Japan as the Senkaku Islands, also called the Pinnacle Islands
Diaoyu Islands, located between Taiwan and Okinawa, controlled by Japan – which calls them the Senkaku Islands – but claimed by China as part of its territory
lit. sitting at ease in a fishing boat despite wind and storm (idiom); to stay calm during tense situation/a cool head in a crisis
pinyin: ren4 ping2 feng1 lang4 qi3 , wen3 zuo4 diao4 yu2 tai2
containing_words.word: 任憑風浪起，穩坐釣魚臺

definition: Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
pinyin: tai4 gong1 diao4 yu2 , yuan4 zhe3 shang4 gou1

definition: Jiang Ziya is fishing, if you want it, take the hook (idiom, refers to early sage 姜子牙 fishing with no bait and the hook above the water); to put one's head in the noose
pinyin: Jiang1 tai4 gong1 diao4 yu2 , yuan4 zhe3 shang4 gou1

definition: lit. sitting at ease in a fishing boat despite storms (idiom); to stay calm during tense situation/a cool head in a crisis

sentences.english: No fishing is allowed within twenty-mile limit.
sentences.chinese: 二十英里範圍內不準釣魚。

sentences.english: Attach it to a shoelace or a string, and you've got yourself a fishing line.
sentences.chinese: 把它系在鞋帶或細線上，釣魚線就大功告成了。

sentences.english: I've been sitting here for hours but the fish aren't biting.
sentences.chinese: 釣魚人等了好久，可是沒有魚上鉤。

sentences.english: I think that in this life, I never see who can come to fish with the branches of Salix.
sentences.chinese: 我想，這輩子，我再也見不到誰能用柳樹枝來釣魚了。

sentences.english: In my early days I used to like to go fishing.
sentences.chinese: 年輕時代我曾喜歡釣魚。

sentences.english: I love fish and you just said there was a lake.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡釣魚，你剛剛也說那邊有個湖了。

sentences.english: In the maldives fishing is also one kind fastens a amorous feelings.
sentences.chinese: 在馬爾代夫釣魚也是一種別有一種風情。

sentences.english: They are watching fishing lines that have disappeared down into black water.
sentences.chinese: 他們觀察着消失在黑色的水中的釣魚線。

sentences.english: Harry had considerable success dapping with the natural fly.
sentences.chinese: 哈里用真蠅輕點水面釣魚相當成功。

sentences.english: We chose steamed fish for cooking our rewards from sunset fishing.
sentences.chinese: 我們要了蒸魚，這可是我們在日落釣魚裏的戰利品。

sentences.english: After picnic the children begin to fly kites. Mr. and Mr. Jackson go fishing by the lake.
sentences.chinese: 午餐後孩子們開始放風箏，傑克遜夫婦在湖邊釣魚。

sentences.english: These are ornamental fish. You are not allowed to catch them.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是觀魚區，不允許釣魚。

sentences.english: Little Cat listened to Old Cat's words and begin to fish intently.
sentences.chinese: 小貓聽了老貓的話，就一心一意地釣魚。

sentences.english: But fishing appears to be the main and favorite activity.
sentences.chinese: 但不用說釣魚是最讓人喜愛的主要活動。

sentences.english: Which animal uses a fishing rod?
sentences.chinese: 什麼動物會用“魚杆”來“釣魚”？

definition: to go for an outing/to go on an excursion
variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
to dive/to go under water/(in an online forum) to lurk
to amuse oneself/to have fun/to go sightseeing/to take a stroll
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
